discussion.content: C, and D refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 191

Selected Answer: CD
CD refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 191

I think the correct answer is D,E
FEC is an error correction control algorithm based on parity bits (not sending duplicate packets of any kind) and because it sends additional bits it will reduce the bandwidth.

choices.A: FEC is useful to increase speed at which traffic is routed through IPsec tunnels.
choices.D: FEC improves reliability, which overcomes adverse WAN conditions such as noisy links.
choices.E: FEC reduces the stress on the remote device jitter buffer to reconstruct packet loss.
choices.C: FEC transmits additional packets as redundant data to the remote device.
choices.B: FEC transmits the original payload in full to recover the error in transmission.

questions.question_text: Which two reasons make forward error correction (FEC) ideal to enable in a phase one VPN interface? (Choose two.)
